geneSummary: CCND1, a regulator of the cell cycle, is amplified in various cancer types including breast, head and neck, and bladder cancers.

mutationEffect.description: The CCND1 P287S mutation is located in the C-terminus of the protein. This mutation has been found in endometrial cancer (PMID: 12955092). While this mutation is a statistically significant hotspot (PMID: 26619011), this mutation has not yet been functionally characterized.

variantSummary: The CCND1 P287S mutation is likely oncogenic.
